page.title: 17Somner Billington (Work)
page.content: {Adbaston} Somner Billington, who died in Sept 1985 was a remarkable man. During a lifetime of farming in Adbaston, and retirement at Kemsey Manor, he took an active part in the local community. He was known and respected by all because of his zest for life, his friendliness and concern. He showed an astonishing range of interests. He wrote a History of Adbaston Parish, was church organist for 40 years and was very practical e.g. he made a set of heavy metal brackets for the new heating system in the church. At various times he held the offices of Church Warden, Vice-chairman of the P.C.C. and Treasurer.
